body.title: Grondstoffenscanner
body.subTitle: Welcome to the Raw Materials Scanner. Here you can find out to what extent (Bio)raw materials on which you depend may be scarce in the future pose a risk to humans and the environment.

box1.boxline3: Gain insight into the raw materials and products that are part of your production process hear
box1.boxline6: Assess whether your business will be in the future at risk.

box2.box2line3: Then go through the risk analysis to gain insight into to get on the risks

box3.box3line2: Raw materials can suddenly be used due to circumstances more expensive, less available or even no longer available available. With the Raw Materials Scanner, you get Insight into the risk profile of the products you use Materials.

box4.box4line2: Answer a few questions about your product and Immediately see which raw materials you use and how it is risk of, for example, scarcity, can be alleged. reduced.

box5.box5line2: For companies in the Netherlands that depend on a stable supply of raw materials, such as metals or bio raw materials.

mobile.heading: International Social Corporate Responsibility
mobile.subHeading: The scanner also provides companies with information about International Civil Society Corporate Responsibility (IRBC). IRBC is an ongoing process that focuses mainly on identifying, preventing and managing social and environmental risks. You can use the information in using the scanner as a first step towards the implementation of due diligence.

paragraphs.intro1: See which critical materials your selected products contain. You can view product groups or raw materials. Here you will see a risk analysis based on supply security, price volatility, and risks to people and the environment.
paragraphs.intro2: If a raw material is designated as a “conflict material,” it is shaded red in the raw material overview.
paragraphs.selectedGroups: For each product group, the raw materials, including their relative amounts, are displayed.
paragraphs.riskAction: If the factsheet(s) for your product group(s) show that you are at risk for one or more raw materials, check 'Act' to see what you can do to mitigate this risk.
paragraphs.note: Please note that these action perspectives are not material-specific and need to be adapted to your specific situation.

trade.heading: Trade
trade.paragraph1: Here you will find actionable perspectives that can help you manage your business risks and the impacts on people and the environment.
trade.paragraph2: Are you looking for more information and support in identifying and addressing negative impacts on people and the environment in metal supply chains? Visit the International CSR Covenant for the Metal Sector website. You can also consult the Circular Procurement Guide tool for additional ideas on closing material loops.

results.setUpSystem: Set up a system to manage supply chain risk in the organization
results.systemDescription: Set up supply chain risk management and a suitable strategy: - Secure the importance and continuity in the organization (for example: appropriate budget and impact on targets). - Analyze what competencies and responsibilities are needed and involve them (for example: purchasing, marketing & sales, R&D, engineering). - Define indicators for determining impact and risks. - Map critical dependencies (suppliers, components, resources, etc.). - For each dependency, create an action plan (compare with HACCP approach). - Analyze the likelihood and impact of delivery issues (financial, reputation, etc.) using a Kraljic analysis. - Establish business continuity plans (for example: insurance). - Design a strategy for dealing with suppliers (for example: periodic audits, communication strategy, etc.).

options.label: Impact on people and the environment (22)

cards.title: Set up a system to manage supply chain risk in the organization
cards.description: Establish supply chain risk management and a suitable strategy: - Ensure importance and continuity in the organization (for example: appropriate budget and impact on targets). - Analyze which competencies and responsibilities are needed and involve them (for example: procurement, marketing & sales, R&D, engineering). - Define indicators for determining impact and risks. - Map critical dependencies (suppliers, components, resources, etc.). - Create an action plan for each dependency (compare with the HACCP approach). - Analyze the likelihood and impact of delivery issues (financial, reputational, etc.), for example, with a Kraljic analysis. - Develop business continuity plans (for example: insurance). - Design a strategy for dealing with suppliers (for example: periodic audits, communication strategy, etc.).

landinfo.heading: Country Information
landinfo.description: On this page, you will find country-specific information.

tableArea.label: Choose which country’s information you want to view

countries.synthetic_yarns: Yarns, other than sewing threads, of synthetic staple fibers, containing < 85% by weight staple fibers
countries.paper_products: Paper and cardboard, of the type used for writing, printing, or other graphic purposes, coated with or containing a coating of kaolin or other inorganic substances

headings.heading2: How Does the Raw Material Scanner Work?

paragraphs.para1: Many companies in the Netherlands depend on a stable supply of raw materials, such as metals or bio-based resources. Due to various circumstances, raw materials can suddenly become much more expensive, harder to obtain, or even unavailable. This could be a risk for your business. You might receive them today, but what about tomorrow? With the Raw Material Scanner, you can assess the risk of future scarcity for the materials your company uses.
paragraphs.para2: You scan a product through the scanner, for example, a phone. You then receive an overview of the possible materials used. Where do they come from? What is the risk profile for each material? This can involve economic risks, as well as environmental and social risks, such as those related to human rights. The Raw Material Scanner visually displays estimates for a selected number of raw materials. You can immediately see the supply security and reputation risk. You also learn what you can do to reduce your risk in a way that aligns with your business strategy.

header.title: Explore: What are you purchasing?
header.paragraph: Search for product groups based on a keyword, product category, or raw material, allowing you to discover which raw materials are needed for production. You can also search further by raw material.

stepOne.title: Choose where you want to retrieve the information from
stepOne.labelOne: Search by name or HS code of the product group

stepTwo.title: Found Results
stepTwo.para: With the results, you can view the factsheet about the raw material or product group or add various product groups to compare the differences.
stepTwo.paraTwo: A raw material factsheet is available for Antimony
stepTwo.titleTwo: Other processed glass, including technical glassware

antimoon.max_price_increase: Maximum price increase, with a slightly longer title
antimoon.max_price_increase_text: This represents the largest price increase recorded in a single year since 1900. A maximum price increase of 100% means that the price of a raw material doubled in a single year. Annual averages are calculated; daily, weekly, and monthly averages are excluded.
antimoon.description: Antimony is mainly used as a flame retardant in plastics (52%). It is also used in lead-acid batteries (27%) and to harden alloys.

expandableSection.import_country_info_description: In the world map below, you can see which countries the Netherlands imports the shown resource from and their scores on Environmental Performance (EPI), Human Development (HDI), and World Governance (WGI).
expandableSection.price_fluctuation_description: Price fluctuations can vary significantly based on various factors such as market demand, seasonal trends, and political stability.
expandableSection.price_trends_description: In the graph below, you can see the price trends from the past years.

import_country.select_info: Which information do you want to see?

long_term_items: Risk of low proven reserves (abiotic resources)
Companionality (extent to which a resource is a by-product)
short_term_items: Risks related to low stability and quality of governance in source countries
Risk that resource is impacted by export restrictions
Risks due to lack of recycling
business_items: Risk of high price volatility of resources/materials
human_environment_items: Risk associated with environmental impact of extraction and production
Risks related to low Human Development Index (HDI)
riskIndicators.low_reserves_risk: Risk of low proven reserves (abiotic resources)
riskIndicators.max_price_increase: Maximum price increase, with a slightly longer title
riskIndicators.max_price_increase_text: This represents the largest price increase recorded in a single year since 1900. A maximum price increase of 100% means that the price of a raw material doubled in a single year. Annual averages are calculated; daily, weekly, and monthly averages are excluded.
